thread.title: US women beat USK Prague 85-53 in tour finale
thread.title_full: US women beat USK Prague 85-53 in tour finale

title: US women beat USK Prague 85-53 in tour finale
text:
US women beat USK Prague 85-53 in tour finale AP 
Oct 10, 2015 at 5:48p ET + Updated Oct 10, 2015 at 5:48p ET 
PRAGUE (AP) Los Angeles Sparks star Candace Parker had 20 points and 11 rebounds to help the U.S. women's team rout EuroLeague champion USK Prague 85-53 on Saturday night in the final game of the Americans' European tour. 
''I think we all came out and played well as a team and it was a good way to end the trip,'' Parker said. ''When we play together and we move the ball and play really good defense, there are very few teams that are going to be able to deal with that for 40 minutes. It's just about persistence.'' 
Atlanta's Angel McCoughtry added 15 points, and Chicago's Elena Delle Donne, Phoenix's Brittney Griner and the University of Connecticut's Breanna Stewart each had 10. 
''I thought the first 15 minutes that we played in the first half was our best 15 minutes of basketball of the whole trip, against the best team that we played the whole trip,'' said coach Geno Auriemma of Connecticut. ''After all the travel and after all the time in hotels and buses and planes, and only three practices and three shootarounds, for our team to come out and play the way we did against a very good team, I think that says a lot about the group that we have. It couldn't have ended on a higher note.'' 
Kia Vaughn led Prague with 13 points. She also plays for Washington in the WNBA. 
The Americans opened Sunday night in Spain with a 94-52 victory over Spanish League champion Uni Girona, beat the Italian national team 79-66 on Wednesday night in Rome, and topped Dike Naples 86-50 on Thursday night in Naples.
